newsitem.title: QATAR: Stocks in Qatar move higher in the week.
newsitem.headline: Stocks in Qatar move higher in the week.

text.p: Shares on Qatar's unofficial market climbed in the week to Thursday, with the share index moving up another half percentage point, brokers said.
The 18-share Commercial Bank of Qatar (CBQ) index moved up to 116.51 points from a previous 115.87 on the back of 10 share price gains. Eight were steady.
The biggest mover in the week was CBQ, which gained six riyals, or almost two percent, to 323 riyals.
Market leader Qatar National Bank added five riyals to 555 and Doha Bank and Al Ahli Bank each gained a riyal to 265 and 204 respectively.

For the second week running, all insurers were up. Market heavyweight Qatar Insurance Co rose five riyals to 645. Khaleej Insurance gained a riyal to 284 and Qatar General Insurance moved up three riyals to 515.
Qatar National Navigation and Transport was two riyals firmer at 684, while Qatar Shipping was steady at 45.50.
Qatar National Cement and Qatar Flour Mills both gained a riyal to 283 each.
